pageContext.claim: “I said this is a great time to fill it up, load it up with oil that, frankly, is -- had pricing that nobody has ever seen before. I don't think we've seen this probably since the 1950s. That was with big dollars.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump apparently doesn't understand that on an inflation-adjusted basis, gasoline prices were the lowest in 1998 ($1.47 a gallon); gasoline prices in the 1950s ranged from $1.94 to $2.14 a gallon. In raw dollars, it's unlikely gasoline would get as low as the 1950s (about 30 cents a gallon).
